intro: Crassina verticillata, commonly known as the whorled crassina, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and the Pacific Islands. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. The plant is characterized by its whorled arrangement of leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
